results.title: To live and learn
results.brief_description: A film about London schools and school-children, showing the work of infant, junior and secondary schools. The film brings out the development of the children’s own personalities as well as showing teaching methods, and illustrates the wide variety of opportunities in London’s grammar and other secondary schools. Interviews with head teachers and parents are included.

results.title: To keep the faith
results.brief_description: A religious documentary with commentary by Francis James. Illustrates the enormous cultural influence of the orthodox church over eastern Europe. Raises the issue of the cultural flux generations of immigrant families find themselves in.

results.title: To help them learn (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Examines the role of audiovisual media in modern education. Encourages the use of media for captivating children’s attention, offering a variety of approaches to learning, and stimulating students through meaningful experiences.

results.title: To hear or not to hear
results.creator_credit: Jill Mansfield, Jeff Osment and Green Hill Films
results.brief_description: A domestic scene is enacted twice - once from the perspective of a busy woman preparing a meal and then as seen by her partially deaf husband. Gives insights into the frustrations of both.

results.title: To build a school house
results.brief_description: Contrasts traditional school building design with modern requirements, showing planning for changes with movable partitions, provision for such needs as language laboratories and visual instruction centres, and ways of adapting existing buildings

results.title: To be a scout
results.brief_description: On his 11th birthday a boy graduates from being a cub to being a boy scout. The various activities of his first year of scouting are shown. These include his first camp, a trip to the Grampians and finally a bicycling camp in Tasmania. The training that scouts receive in disclipine, handicraft and nature study is brought out in the film.

results.title: Titanic
results.brief_description: The Titanic carried 2208 passengers, 705 were saved, 1503 died. This film re-constructs the sinking of the boat and the terror of the passengers using drawings and old photographs. The horror of the disaster, the victims, the rescue and the safe arrival of survivors in port is linked by a song.

results.title: Time for access
results.creator_credit: Deborah Tennet and Wellington Polytechnic Photographic Students Production
results.brief_description: Follows a day in the lives of Michael, a paraplegic and Jane who is visually impaired as they meet to prepare for a concert performance. Shows them engaged in normal everyday activities, rather than focusing on their disabilities.

results.title: Timber
results.creator_credit: Gary Payne, Earle Noble, Robert Landucci and Crest Films
results.brief_description:
A non-narrated look at the logging and milling of timber in Canada. Raises issues about the environment and use of technology and transport.
Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
